paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv) with cardiac involvement

individual_records.evidence_sentence: At the time of the summation of the data (mean 59 months after DPD examination), twelve of the patients (25%) had died.

functional_data.summary: The study correlates DPD uptake with echocardiographic strain values and cardiac biomarkers.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families as indicated by the presence of mutations in affected individuals.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on clinical correlation and family segregation
variants.additional_notes: The most common mutation was Val30Met found in 39 of the 48 patients (81%).
key_quotes: One of the most common causes of CA is transthyretin (TTR) amyloid (ATTR) amyloidosis.
A total of eight different ATTR mutations were present.

tables_processed.table_caption: Clinical and demographic characteristics of included patients
99mTc-DPD measurements for different volumes of interest, defined in Fig. 2

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data focused on the TTR gene and its associated penetrance information.
